synopses.large:
Tris and Four escape the chaos in Chicago and seek sanctuary out in the toxic Fringe. Yet even here, rigid rules and intrigues impose control on them.  

Third film in the dystopian sci-fi trilogy based on the novels by Veronica Roth.
synopses.small: Tris and Four escape the chaos in Chicago and seek sanctuary out in the toxic Fringe.
synopses.medium: Tris and Four escape the chaos in Chicago and seek sanctuary out in the toxic Fringe. Yet even here, rigid rules and intrigues impose control on them.

synopses.large:
Tris and Four escape the chaos in Chicago and seek sanctuary out in the toxic Fringe. Yet even here, rigid rules and intrigues impose control on them.  

Third film in the dystopian sci-fi trilogy based on the novels by Veronica Roth.
synopses.small: Tris and Four escape the chaos in Chicago and seek sanctuary out in the toxic Fringe.
synopses.medium: Tris and Four escape the chaos in Chicago and seek sanctuary out in the toxic Fringe. Yet even here, rigid rules and intrigues impose control on them.
synopses.editorial: The battle for humanity begins. Can Tris uncover the truth of the world around them?

synopses.large:
James Blake - a 30-year-old entrepreneur from Lisburn - was living the Insta-dream until someone scraped his accounts. He started getting messages from people accusing him of conning them out of tens of thousands of pounds.
 
As he sets out to try and get his face and name back, James discovers a dark and utterly heartless modern-day crime wave where ruthless organised gangs are using the very latest technology to prey on our age-old desire for love, companionship and success, all to scam blameless victims out of money. 
 
James’s attempt to find out more and get his online identity back takes him on an international journey, and he discovers that it’s not only those being conned who are the victims here - many of those carrying out the con are also suffering at the hands of the gangs behind this modern-day crime.
synopses.small: James's attempts to recover his stolen identity unearth a shocking web of organised crime.
synopses.medium: Having posted his life on social media, James Blake's identity is stolen and used in scams. In a fight to get his identity back, he uncovers a world of organised crime.

synopses.editorial: Living in a digital world. What do you do when the pics of your success are used to scam?

synopses.large: Rav Wilding is hunting down the scammers plaguing our lives. Working with ethical hackers to hack into the fraudsters’ illegal call centres, Rav uses cutting-edge technology to monitor the scammers’ phone calls in an effort to stop victims losing out to real-time scams.
synopses.small: Working with ethical hackers, Rav Wilding is hunting down the scammers plaguing our lives.
synopses.medium: Working with ethical hackers, Rav Wilding is hunting down the scammers plaguing our lives – using cutting-edge tech to catch out the crooks.

synopses.large: A man believes he is on the cusp of an incredible new phone deal from his mobile company. But in fact, he is talking to scammers who are about to use the information he is giving them to buy themselves a very expensive mobile phone on his account. The only people who can stop it going ahead are Rav, Nick and the Interceptors – if they can find a way to get hold of him.
synopses.small: The team try to stop scammers who pretend to be from a mobile phone company.
synopses.medium: A man believes he is talking to his mobile phone company - but in fact, they are scammers, and he is about to buy them a very expensive mobile phone.

synopses.large:
Since Nadiya Hussain won Bake Off in 2015 she’s rarely been off our screens. But behind the scenes Nadiya suffers from extreme anxiety and debilitating panic attacks, which she’s had since childhood. For decades, she has kept her anxiety a secret, ashamed to speak out. 
 
She’s never had a proper diagnosis but thinks she has an anxiety disorder, and with around 5 million people suffering from the condition in the UK, Nadiya is not alone.
 
In this one-off documentary for BBC One, Nadiya sets out to find the cause of her anxiety, exploring the most effective, available treatments, whilst having therapy herself, in the hope of managing her anxiety.
 
She speaks bravely and honestly about what it’s like to live with anxiety and panic attacks; undergoing a course of cognitive behaviour therapy, each session is a step into the unknown. At times, it’s a difficult process, revealing buried memories and key moments from her past. These sessions are raw and honest, but Nadiya hopes her openness will inspire others to seek help rather than suffer in silence.
 
She wants to understand how anxiety is affecting the nation’s health, meeting fellow sufferers in the hope of understanding her own issues. Nadiya talks to Laura Bartley about her experiences of treating her anxiety with medication, visits a school in Brighton to see how they are tackling anxiety in their students, and goes online to meet Barry McDonagh, who offers support and therapy to an online community of around 250,000.
 
Nadiya wants to find out if her anxiety was something she was born with, fearing she might pass it onto her children. At Kings College London, Nadiya hopes groundbreaking research into the role of genetics and environment on anxiety disorders can give her the answers she needs.

Raw, open and honest, this documentary will speak to the millions of people in the UK suffering with anxiety disorders, shining a light and starting a debate about on an increasingly pressing issue.
synopses.small: Nadiya Hussain sets out to find the cause of her anxiety, and explores various treatments.
synopses.medium: In this one-off documentary, Nadiya Hussain sets out to find the cause of her anxiety, exploring the most effective, available treatments.

synopses.small: Drama documentary that probes the minds of the three most notorious Nazis in the dock.
synopses.medium: Drama documentary that probes the minds of the three most notorious Nazis in the dock at the greatest trial of the 20th century.

synopses.large:
After his bizarre flight to Scotland in 1941 to offer peace to Britain, Hitler's deputy, Rudolf Hess, was declared insane by the Fuhrer. 

At Nuremberg, Hess's fitness for trial was at the centre of his case, as he claimed not to remember his Nazi past and was seemingly suffering from paranoid delusions.
synopses.small: At Nuremberg, Rudolf Hess claimed not to remember his Nazi past.
synopses.medium: Documentary drama looking at Rudolph Hess at the Nuremberg trials, where he claimed not to remember his Nazi past and was seemingly suffering from paranoid delusions.

text.large: Contains scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.
Contains scenes which some viewers may find upsetting.

synopses.small: Drama series about a young policeman whose beat is a seemingly sleepy Highland village.
synopses.medium: PC Hamish Macbeth would love a quiet life - but goings-on in the deceptively sleepy Highland village of Lochdubh means it's the last thing he’ll get. Starring Robert Carlyle.

synopses.small: Kenneth and Ava have stolen the Stone of Destiny and TV John is missing.
synopses.medium: Kenneth and Ava have stolen the Stone of Destiny and TV John is missing.

synopses.small: Historical drama series examining the reigns of Augustus, Tiberius, Caligula and Claudius
synopses.medium: The acclaimed epic drama of madness, murder and debauchery. With Derek Jacobi, Sian Phillips and Brian Blessed bringing ancient Rome's power, corruption and lies to life.

synopses.small: Almost at the end of his family history, Claudius's thoughts turn to the future of Rome.
synopses.medium: Acclaimed historical drama series chronicling the reigns of the Roman emperors. Almost at the end of his family history, Claudius's thoughts turn to the future of Rome.

synopses.small: An actress enters the world of espionage in this adaptation of John le Carre's novel.
synopses.medium: Seduction, betrayal and spies. A fiery actress meets a mysterious stranger, and is caught up in a deadly espionage sting. With Florence Pugh and Alexander Skarsgard.

synopses.large:
Khalil takes Charlie to an isolated house where he builds a bomb for the planned attack on Professor Minkel - an outspoken academic. Meanwhile, Kurtz and Becker are concerned about Charlie's state of mind and where her allegiances lie.

In her greatest test so far in the 'theatre of the real', Charlie delivers the bomb to the university moments before Professor Minkel is due to speak. Kurtz and Becker work with British intelligence officer Picton to try to avert bloodshed and turn the situation to their advantage. When Kurtz discovers that Charlie is working with Khalil, he sees an opportunity to help Charlie rise to the top of Khalil's network alongside the great man himself. Finally, an agent on the inside.

But having grown so close to those she is tasked with betraying, will Charlie bend to the will of Kurtz and Becker at the last? And can Kurtz and his team outsmart Khalil, the genius that he has been chasing for so many years?

Torn between love of Becker, respect and sympathy for Khalil, and a wavering belief in the righteousness of her quest, Charlie's identity is tested to its very limit in a nail-biting season finale.
synopses.small: Charlie prepares for her part in Khalil's next strike, but has she really switched sides?
synopses.medium: Charlie prepares for her part in Khalil's next strike. But is she still playing a role, or has she switched to the other side?

synopses.small: Sam Waterston stars as J Robert Oppenheimer in the award-winning biopic from 1980.
synopses.medium: Sam Waterston stars as J Robert Oppenheimer in the award-winning biopic from 1980. A fascinating take on the brilliant, conflicted physicist and father of the atom bomb.

synopses.large: December 1953: Oppenheimer has been accused of being a Soviet agent and the President has cancelled his security clearance until his case is fully investigated. Oppenheimer has to choose between resignation or facing a security hearing.
synopses.small: Oppenheimer has to choose between resignation or facing a security hearing.
synopses.medium: December 1953: Oppenheimer has been accused of being a Soviet agent. Oppenheimer has to choose between resignation or facing a security hearing.

synopses.small: A family find themselves trapped in their home. Will DI Caffrey reach them in time?
synopses.medium: Life is full of surprises. A gruesome shock for a wealthy family, and a young detective with horrors of his own. It's a deliciously bloody, twisting race against time.

synopses.small: DI Jack Caffery closes in on his suspects, but will he get to the captive family in time?
synopses.medium: When Jack unearths a clue that leads him to the Anchor-Ferrers’ home, our two narratives race forward on a nail-biting collision course.
synopses.editorial: 6/6 Knock, Knock. A clue leads Jack to the captive family, but will he get there in time?

synopses.small: Drama inspired by one of the most complex criminal cases in recent memory.
synopses.medium: An inspirational teacher is courted by a student, triggering a complex criminal case. A sinister real-life story starring Timothy Spall and Anne Reid.

synopses.small: The case comes to court, and the victims’ families discover the truth of what happened.
synopses.medium: The case comes to court, and the victims’ families discover the truth of what happened to their loved ones as new revelations emerge.

synopses.large: After the strain of Timothy Evans's trial, Christie finds it increasingly difficult to maintain the charade. As his marriage breaks down, he embarks upon a course of action which finally reveals his true nature to the world.
synopses.small: Under the stress of Timothy Evans's trial, Christie's true nature begins to reveal itself.
synopses.medium: Drama series based on a true story. Feeling the strain of Timothy Evans's trial, Christie's behaviour becomes increasingly erratic and his true nature starts to reveal itself.

synopses.medium: It never goes away. Sgt Catherine Cawood is tough, defiant and facing her traumatic past. Sarah Lancashire in Sally Wainwright's northern noir.

synopses.small: Scores are settled for good on Catherine’s final shift.
synopses.medium: Scores are settled for good on Catherine’s final shift, and Ryan faces a moral dilemma.

synopses.medium: It's not personal, it's just business, right? Under a company's shiny happy surface, a new recruit cracks open the doors of a hidden scandal. With Maxine Peake and Rakhee Thakrar.

synopses.small: A disgraced ex-army surgeon signs up to a whaling expedition to the Arctic.
synopses.medium: A disgraced surgeon joins an Arctic whaling expedition - a voyage to the edge of reason, brutality and humanity. Epic drama with Jack O’Connell, Colin Farrell and Stephen Graham.

synopses.small: Sumner heads to Hull to settle old scores, but can he outrun his demons – and Drax?
synopses.medium: After healing in a missionary cabin, Sumner returns to Hull to demand money from Baxter to start a new life. Can he outrun his demons, and has he really seen the last of Henry Drax?

synopses.small: Documentary series confronting social and political issues in contemporary society.
synopses.medium: Documentary series confronting social and political issues in contemporary society.

synopses.large: First transmitted in 1971, John Pitman reports from Hyde Park, which was Henry VIII's former hunting ground. The park has now become home to early morning keep-fit swimmers, sailors and fishers of the sometimes frozen waters of the Serpentine, members of the Household Cavalry exercising their horses and the rather less formally attired civilian riders on Rotten Row, as well as fashion photographers, free speakers at Speakers' Corner and a vast army of other park lovers.
synopses.small: John Pitman reports on a day in the life of Hyde Park. (1971)
synopses.medium: First transmitted in 1971, John Pitman reports on a day in the life of Hyde Park, meeting the soldiers who live there, early morning Serpentine swimmers and other local characters.
